message: This thread will be directed to a PyCon wiki page by Tuesday.
I'd like to support the Board Game Social event and learn who is coordinating it, or interested in that.  I was coordinator in 2008 and supporter in 2009.
If you are looking forward to the event, please leave a comment on which games you are looking forward to, and if you are bringing that game.
Board Game Social sounds awesome! One of my favorite games right now is Carcassonne. I can bring it.
@jrothenbuhler : Great! Are you local or flying in?
I'll be flying in from San Francisco
@voidspace I'm hoping the same thing, I've got it but as I'm only bringing a carry-on I don't think I'll have room
I'll be there, and I'll be bringing Agricola.
I hope lots of people are bringing settlers of catan...
@stephenreid I don't want Risk. :-) There is also settlers of catan on the ipad. I figure it would be much more fun as a board game (with real cards) though.
Settlers for the iPad? That would be pretty good. All the fun, none of the cleanup.
oohh, Dominion would be fun.
There is Risk on the Ipad @voidspace @jrothenbuhler
I'm in but I travelling from SF I suspect anything that isn't a card game won't hold up well :-/ Fluxx or Set anyone?
I could try and fit Dominion into a smaller box perhaps
I've got Settlers for iPad but it's my wife's :( This is just the excuse I need to buy iPad 2 !!!
@wolever non-board board gaming  will never be as fun =) I'm up for any boardgames, won't be bringing anything of my own though, too many connecting flights to risk a game...
@wolever ok, point taken. I'll amend that to 'non-board gaming so far has never been as fun'... ;-)

@haard I don't know… I enjoy board games for the strategy and company, not the “setting up” and “cleaning up when the bits fly everywhere”… So I could imagine non-board games being pretty fun, if they are done well.
@wolever Usually just a scale problem, only so many people can fit around an iPad. Get a projector aimed at a table and some optical tracking and we are in business though ;-)
@mwhooker that would be awesome, I'll be bringing river expansion.
oh awesome. maybe I'll bring some carcassonne expansions
on what day is the event held?
I have brought my games (Fluxx and Carcasonne, and some other stuff)
@wolever Board game cleanup usually goes unnoticed while the conversation estabilished in game carries on. :)
@ponderings great. Which is every Conference night? Or all PyCon nights?
@jamespaxi The event is every night the Open Spaces is available.            @dougn Thank you!
@ponderings that is true… Although the house I normally play in also contains two puppies, which occasionally try to get involved in our games.
@jamespaxi I'll be there for the sprints, and I'll be up for games at least some of those nights.
@wolever me too :) let's make it happen :P
@elpargo if it's not inconvenient, you should probably bring it. IIRC, there are never enough Catan boards.
I'll love to attend to this. I bought the Real Board game for Catan, some time ago I can probably take it if noone else is.

@wolvever :-) Ohhhh puppies. I've lost a few game boxes to ours.    If someone who gets there whenever would hang a sign on an open space room door, I've heard of gaming from Tutorials through Sprints.  One year the Sprinter's were disappointed to not find a chess board available.
I have Catan and the six player expansion I can bring.
I'll can bring Munchkin and Munchkin Quest, any takers?
Yea! I've only played it a couple times, but it was a lot of fun.
It doesn't seem like there have been very many people expressing interest in *particular* games here…
Why do the games include costs? I was under the impression that everyone just brought their own…

I may be able to fit a few other games into my suitcase (in which case I'll try to bring Dominion and perhaps Settlers, although last year folks were playing Settlers over the Internet  pretty easily, so it may not require the board version quite as much. Perhaps PowerGrid then.
I plan on bringing a few games I've been digging lately: Homesteaders, Phoenecia, and Puerto Rico. Also will bring a stash of Loony Labs Pyramids
Oh man, I love blockus, I hope that shows up
Power Grid is fun, but at least when I've played it, it just took too long (>2 hours). Maybe I was just doing it wrong?

@wolever My costs notes were about sourcing if there wasn't the awesome participation response that it looks like we have. :-)      No, Power Grid can go long, my wife refused to play with people prone to Analysis Paralysis as the downtime between turns is too great.

@william_mcvey Thank so you much for bringing games! Pyramids are always welcome, do you have some Twin Win decks printed?  One of my favorites, along with Martian Coasters.   Thanks for the notes from last year!   I think Dominion was in constant play in 09.    Do you have a San Juan deck?  Sean R. led some great groups of that, sadly he can't make it this year.
@g_c_c Munchkin was fun in `08, if you are interested in playing please bring it! The un-assuming humor of it makes it a great crowd draw.
@wolever those seem like prices to buy online. But As you said I believe this is people should take theirs. At least that's how I remember it was.

@elpargo I've removed pricing as it is now irrelevant. :-)  If someone wants to pickup Dominion for close to retail, hopefully less if you bundled and negotiated - http://atlanta.craigslist.org/nat/tag/2250882337.html
I also have the ipad catan version :)

FYI I plan to buy Carcassone, Qwirkle, Ticket to Ride Europe and Mexican Train. To bring back home. If someone is willing to make the arrangements to buy them I'll pay the cost and bring them back home. I just don't know where to buy them and how to get them fast.

I currently have the following games. Catan (first expansion only). Rummikub, Sequence and Skip-Bo. I'm traveling from abroad so I'll like to take as little as possible. I'm thinking of Catan (by demand) and Skip-Bo (because it's small).

PyCon Wiki page setup, needs lots of editing and migration from this page and past pages -   http://us.pycon.org/2011/openspaces/BoardgameSocial/   .  I'm splitting whistles here and just confirmed my flight and room!
Thanks for the link for buying the games. I plan to bring back a couple of them based on what I end up liking from this BOF
@elpargo Good choices!    I have the iPod Touch Carcassonne version I'm looking forward to trying.    Will be bringing San Juan, a Dominion deck or two (no box to save space), Hive, and Aquarius.
@ponderings Nice I didn't knew they had an Ipad version. May get that one instead :) Will love to play the others you mention I haven't and may end up buying them.
Anyone interested (and can bring) Alhambra? I really enjoy it but can't bring it.
Anyone up for some games tonight?
Anybody interested in Illuminati? I won't be able to stay and play, but I could drop off my box with someone as long as it gets returned on Sunday.
Games night tonight in the Green Room?
I've updated the wiki page (http://us.pycon.org/2011/openspaces/BoardgameSocial/ ), making the formatting a bit nicer and adding my game to the “list of what will be there”
@wolever thanks, and I've added my info to the wiki
@jrothenbuhler Strange… I'd committed the changes =
@wolever is says you locked the wiki?
@jrothenbuhler Anyway, I've edited-then-cancled, which looks like it breaks the lock
@jrothenbuhler Hhmm… now it says that you're holding the lock. I guess the wiki code is a bit buggy?

@wolever  I tried to edit/cancel to break the lock it said you've locked it, but refreshing my browser a few times allows me to edit, but then refreshing again and the lock is apparently back on... very strange
Was Wednesday night a go?
anyone wanting to play Carcassonne online (ipod/ipad/iphone) invite me: ricky-at-thinker-dt-ca
Where are the tables?
2 active tables. I just brought in my games. Dominion, Pandemic, Word on the Street, San Juan, Archeology, Pickomino
^ yea where are they? green room ?
I've brought Inevitable; anyone up for a game? I'm going to be at the Scotch BoF tonight, but tomorrow I'd love to sit down for some Dystopian board game geekery.
Are most people going out tonight, or is there interest in ordering in some food to the board game space?
where are the board games at? :)
They have been in one of the rooms downstairs
@mwhooker i am... i didn't bring my board games though, couldn't fit them in carryon ;)
I believe the BOF is booked for the H room again.
@offby1 Thanks! I was hoping this topic would carry over to Saturday. Will be following that topic there.  https://convore.com/pycon-2011/sampling-local-cuisine/
@mwhooker - yeah
@ponderings I'm for going out for dinner. I'm trying to drum up interest in the Local Cuisine topic.
any boardgames tonight?
anyone down for carcasonne tonight?
@mwhooker I will love to learn that one
Inevitable is... inevitable.
@offby1 what's the playtime on inevitable?
Sweet. I'll be there some time in the evening (after testing BoF)
I'll be playing this evening I'm sure... after TiP BOF though. It's pretty much a given that boardgames will be happening into the night every night.
@mumrah same here
would probably have averse affects on the game dynamic
i brought Settlers
is there time in the open space for this?
I'm gonna eat dinner first though, what time and where are you guys meeting up?
i feel like there should be some way of combining two boards
I plan to go to the tip BOF then dinner then games today. So I'll be there late 10ish maybe
I just happened upon this group. This is relevant to my interests...
I would be up for a game of settlers tonight and could maybe get @steve_piercy to try it
BTW I also have a Catan set :)
@elpargo Do you have the 2 player extension?
Unpredictable. I've only played twice, it's pretty new to me.
I'd be down for Settlers tonight after dinner, or Agricola if anyone brought it
I'm going to have Inevitable with me: http://inevitablethegame.com/
it's pretty complicated
but awsome
anybody have dominion?
awesome *
+1 for Agricola, -0 for Settlers
I saw Agricola yesterday and It looks intimidating. But I'll love to learn.
@djdarkbeat no sorry, mine is vanilla. :(
@ChristianOudard I have left my Dominion and Intrigue set down there, and a few Seaside cards (no orange, only brought cards), but enough coin and treasure cards for 2 games.
It can be over pretty quick, but that was with three players. It maxes at 6. Probably shorter than Arkham Horror, longer than Dominion.
I also have Fluxx with me, if people want that.

Agricola is all about the breeding. How'd the five player game I saw getting started last night go? It can take a long time to play. I suggest a speed version limiting turn time once people know how it works.
+1 for settlers
bump
do some of the boardgamers wanna grab food right now?
agricola took a couple of hours, but we were going sloooow with three new players, and one who had played once before
It looks like the room is being used by another group right now
I just utterly failed to find the social. Where are you people?
Yeah, I saw that there were still games laid out.
I figure if I see noise on this room again before I fade out completely I'll pop down.
Or I'll drop in on the TiP BoF.
I ended up giving up and going back to my room to chill out. I'm exhausted.
Where are things happening?
@offby1 It's still raucous in here!
Nowhere, as far as I can tell
Depends on how lat
Late
When the testing BoF is over, I'll be up for games
Will anyone else?
Depeness
Yeesh
Heading over w/ carcasonne extensions
Expansions
Yea. I ended up going to the TiP
Hm
I think I could do that.
I'm pretty wiped.
Well, I'm still awake, but I don't think I'm up for a full length game.
It's a shame nothing came together.
some people missed an epic Munchkin game... going on till 3am
keep me in the loop when you guys go to Santa Clara next year
@ponderings , I meant, I live & work around there.

@dnozay Hopefully I and others will prepare and promote the board game social more next year. (I couldn't commit early enough).  Next year we should dedicate a room, procure a consistent availability of games (sponsorship?), and blog and promote--I didn't even check to see if it got a program blurb. An small graphic writeup would be ideal.  Thank you so much participants and game luggers this year!

I am leaving this afternoon.   If someone would mail me my games I would be happy to loan any of the games I brought to them (see wiki page), with the understanding that you would mail them to me in WI in a few weeks.
Anyone up for this afternoon?
@elpargo I'll be gone, sorry. :(  Did you get to a game store and make the purchases you were looking forward to?
I'll do that this afternoon or the next one
Will love to get recommendations as to where to go. I was thinking toys r us. There is one north via MARTA

@elpargo You may find quirckle at Toys R Us but you'll probably need a games or hobby store for Ticket to Ride and Carcassonne--maybe Borders or Barnes and Noble.  Is it hard to send items from U.S. to D.R.?

@ponderings Thanks I'll check their online store first. As for shipping stuff to DR is not that bad but it's expensive. And slow. It's over $3 per pound and with amazon free shipping it takes about 3 weeks to get there. Last batch of games I bought cost me like 30$ to get there so about 8$ each
@elpargo OK, ping me off-list of you want to talk about other ways I buy or trade games. goodmansond-gmail
@dnozay aja I found it Munchkin. Couldn't play it there but I'll buy one to play here at home :)
